description: From Middle English foresayen, foreseyen, foreseggen (found only in past participle foresaid), from Old English foreseċġan (“to foresay, foretell, predict, announce, mention beforehand”), equivalent to fore- +‎ say. Cognate with Dutch voorzeggen (“to foretell, presage”), Old Danish foresige, Swedish föresäga, förutsäga (“to predict”).

verbs.description: foresay (third-person singular simple present foresays, present participle foresaying, simple past and past participle foresaid)

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To say beforehand; predict; foretell.
